---
title: CES-D vs MFQ
---

## CES-D vs MFQ

Comparing questionnaire items for psychological research can be a tedious task. One common comparison is CES-D vs MFQ - the Center for Epidemiological Studies-Depression Scale and the Mood & Feelings Questionnaire. Both of these instruments are used to measure depressive symptoms in individuals, yet their questions and scales differ. Harmony, an advanced software tool designed for psychologists, offers an effective solution to this issue by using natural language processing and generative AI models to harmonise these items, making CES-D vs MFQ comparisons efficient and reliable.

## Compare the items in CES-D English and MFQ

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import CES-D and MFQ into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just CES-D into Harmony</a> - compare CES-D English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just MFQ into Harmony</a> - compare MFQ with other instruments


Harmony not only simplifies the assessment process but also enhances the accuracy of CES-D vs MFQ comparisons. The software uses large language models to compare and match questionnaire items, providing a percentage match between each item on the CES-D and MFQ. This can significantly reduce human error and subjective bias, while also saving researchers time. Furthermore, Harmony can handle multiple languages, making it easier for researchers to work with international cohorts and diversify their samples.

Harmony is a powerful tool for psychologists conducting CES-D vs MFQ comparisons or similar research tasks. It effectively harmonises questionnaire items, saving valuable time, and enhancing the overall accuracy of data harvested from these instruments. Ultimately, Harmony bridges the gap between different psychological measurement tools, making research processes easy, fast, and accurate. Consider using Harmony today for your CES-D vs MFQ harmonisation needs.
